conclusion: Problem involves shadows changing when a light source moves forward.
Four objects labeled A, B, C, and D casting shadows on the ground.
Light source is above objects, need to determine shadow changes in location and size.
Object A looks like a mushroom or organic shape.
Object B appears to be a typewriter.
Object C seems like a feather or small animal.
Object D is a peach.
Shadows A, B, C, and D are cast on textured ground.
Position of shadow depends on light source and object position.
Shadow becomes larger when light source moves closer to object.
Shadow becomes smaller when light source moves away from object.
Direction of shadow changes based on direction of light source.
Light source is moving forward in the same horizontal plane as shadows.
Object A is on the left, casting shadow A.
Object B is slightly to the right and behind A, casting shadow B.
Object C is further to the right and a bit in front, casting shadow C.
Object D is on the far right, casting shadow D.
Shadows are positioned directly below or behind objects depending on light source's position.
If light source moves forward, it moves away from observer, assuming forward is towards top of image.
Light source moving forward means moving horizontally away from objects in forward direction.
If light source is directly above, moving forward means moving parallel to ground in forward direction.
